in a way that shows someone is able to quickly understand a situation and see how to get an advantage from it: They took over the company and astutely transformed it into a tech giant. She astutely observed that invisible black ice on a paved surface is not, by its nature, obvious or easy to see. See

He very astutely understood that many people planning to vote for him would not if he was more well-spoken.
